subject: Design
title: The Anglepoise Lamp: Engineering Meets Light
description: A 60-second lesson on The Anglepoise Lamp: Engineering Meets Light.

hook.text: In 1932, George Carwardine used vehicle suspension springs to make a lamp that stays exactly where you put it.

buildup.text: A car engineer, Carwardine realized constant-tension springs could balance a lamp arm at any angle.

discovery.text: The Anglepoise moves freely but holds position â€” mimicking a human arm's range of motion.

twist.text: Pixar's mascot Luxo Jr. is an Anglepoise lamp. The most famous animated character is a desk light.

climax.text: The Anglepoise shows that transferring engineering from one field to another creates iconic design.

punchline.text: A car suspension engineer lit the world's desks.

quiz.question: What technology inspired the Anglepoise lamp?
